required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-HIV False Positivity Rate in Pregnant Women; and Investigating the Factors Affecting This Situation
clinical_study.official_title: Anti-HIV False Positivity Rate in Pregnant Women; and Investigating the Factors Affecting This Situation

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: HIV virus is an etiologic agent of ( AIDS ) immunodeficiency syndrome . It is known that the estimated rate of transfer from mother to baby is 25% to 45%, pregnancy rate is 5-10%, pregnancy rate is 15-20% and in lactation period is 5-10%. Risk factors; maternal viral load, breastfeeding, vaginal birth, and prematurity. Although there is a high rate of false positivity in prenatal screening in our country, one of the factors affecting this is the number of pregnancies.

primary_outcome.measure: The effect of the number of pregnancies on Anti HIV false positivity rate

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women between 8 and 40 weeks of gestation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Anti HIV seropositive Pregnant Women
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anti HIV seronegative Pregnant Women

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
